summary: Broadband internet is critical for work, school, and daily life. "Middle-mile" infrastructure connects networks serving homes and businesses with global networks to deliver broadband. The National Telecommunications and Information Administration was authorized to set up a $1 billion grant program to improve this infrastructure's nationwide availability. While NTIA followed some leading practices for the program, it didn't set measurable goals with specific targets—which would allow...
title: Broadband Infrastructure: Middle-Mile Grant Program Lacked Timely Performance Goals and Targeted Measures
